required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neurophysiologic Changes in Patients With Bipolar Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Exploring Alterations of Central Autonomic Modulation in Patients With Bipolar Depression

brief_summary.textblock:
- To examine differences in neurophysiologic parameters between unmedicated patients with bipolar depression and healthy controls
- To examine within-subject changes in neurophysiologic parameters in patients with bipolar depression treated with quetiapine

detailed_description.textblock:
- Alterations of neurophysiologic regulation has been suggested in patients with major depressive disorder or bipolar disorders
- Depressive phase of bipolar disorder shows multi-faceted characteristics different from unipolar depression
- Quetiapine is an atypical antipsychotic licensed for treatment of bipolar depression
- The aim of this study is to investigate the pattern of neurophysiologic dysregulation in bipolar depression and its changes induced by quetiapine treatment

primary_outcome.description: heart rate variability parameters of time/frequency/complexity domains

secondary_outcome.description: integrative parameters of interaction between neurocardiac dynamics and respiratory rhythm
Electrical brain activities measured by quantitative electroencephalography
Hamilton Depression Rating Scale Bipolar Depression Rating Scale Young Mania Rating Scale Difficulties in Emotion Regulation Scale Emotion Regulation Questionnaire

arm_group.description: unmedicated patients with bipolar depression receiving quetiapine treatment
healthy controls matched for age, gender, and body mass index

intervention.description: oral tablet/25-600mg per day/once a day/six weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- DSM-IV bipolar disorder I or II
- Depressive phase
- Drug-naive or drug-free
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious medical or neurological conditions
- DSM-IV substance-related disorders (within 12 months prior to participation)
- Mentally retarded

facility.name: Department of Neuropsychiatry, Seoul National University Bundang Hospital

link.description: Click here for more information about recent updates on bipolar disorder research
